name: MacRitchie Reservoir
overview: Singapore's oldest reservoir, MacRitchie is a playground for nature lovers and exercise enthusiasts. It anchors the Central Catchment Nature Reserve and is known for its hiking trails, pontoon bridge, and the TreeTop Walk.
scenic: HSBC TreeTop Walk - A 250m one-way suspension bridge through the rainforest canopy with panoramic views.
Jelutong Tower - A 7-deck observation tower offering a view of the forest canopy.
Chemperai Boardwalk - Scenic boardwalk skirting the edge of the reservoir with easy waterside walking.
hours: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM daily (TreeTop Walk closed Mondays)

name: Bukit Timah Nature Reserve
overview: Home to Singapore's highest hill, this reserve contains one of the few areas of primary rainforest left in the country. It offers challenging trails and a rich diversity of flora and fauna.
scenic: Bukit Timah Hill Summit - Singapore’s highest natural peak at about 163 m, reached via several steep forest trails.
Hindhede Quarry - Family-friendly loop with a dramatic cliff-and-lake viewpoint right beside the visitor centre.
Primary Rainforest - One of Singapore’s last patches of primary rainforest, rich in dipterocarp trees and native wildlife.

name: Rail Corridor
overview: A former railway line transformed into a continuous green passage that runs through the island. It's a popular spot for walking, running, and cycling, connecting various green spaces.
transport: King Albert Park MRT (DT6) or Hillview MRT (DT3)
scenic: Historic Truss Bridges - Iconic steel truss railway bridge over Bukit Timah and Dunearn Roads, a classic photo spot.
Bukit Timah Railway Station - Conserved heritage station buildings serving as a key access point.
Clementi Forest - View of the misty jungle from the corridor.
hours: Open 24/7 (Not lit at night, leave before dark recommended)

name: Coney Island
overview: A rustic, ecologically sustainable park with a wide variety of habitats, including coastal forests, grasslands, mangroves, and casuarina woodlands. It's great for cycling and bird watching.
scenic: Coastal Trails - Rustic trails and quiet beaches along the Johor Strait.
Casuarina Woodlands - Groves that support diverse birds and wildlife in a wild-feeling setting.
Haw Par Beach Villa - Atmospheric remains of old structures viewable from the paths.
hours: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM daily (Gates close at 7 PM)

name: Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve
overview: Singapore's first ASEAN Heritage Park, this wetland reserve is a haven for migratory birds and mangrove wildlife. It features boardwalks through mangroves and mudflats.
scenic: Migratory Bird Paradise - 231 recorded bird species including whimbrels, plovers, and white-bellied sea eagles.
Eagle Point - Coastal observation area perfect for sunrise viewing and spotting white-bellied sea eagles.
Crocodile & Monitor Habitat - Only place in Singapore where saltwater crocodiles can be spotted in their natural habitat.

name: Labrador Nature Reserve
overview: A park that offers a unique blend of nature and history. It features the only rocky sea-cliff on the mainland and World War II relics like tunnels and a fort.
scenic: Rocky Sea-Cliff - Singapore's unique coastal geological feature offering tide pool exploration.
World War II Heritage Sites - Historic British Fort Pasir Panjang relics, bunkers, and artillery monuments.
Berlayer Creek Mangrove Trail - Scenic 2.1-km coastal boardwalk through pristine mangrove forest.
hours: Nature Reserve: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM | Park areas: Open 24 hours
